definition_of_done: Documented all flags, defaults, and exit codes from bin/task-agent.sh and bin/ralph-loop.sh.
Captured stop-reason semantics (human, blocked, dependencies, no tasks).
Recorded any implicit behaviors needed for parity (workspace, prompt, logging).

recommended.approach: Create a concise mapping note to drive Rust parity and tests.

tasks.title: Catalog shell behaviors and exit codes

definition_of_done: lever parses --next, --workspace, --assignee, --reset-task, and --delay.
Flag validation matches shell semantics (required combinations and errors).
--loop parsing still accepts optional count.

recommended.approach: Extend clap definitions and add validation helpers before deeper logic changes.

tasks.title: Add missing CLI flags to lever

definition_of_done: Tasks file discovery uses prd.json then tasks.json when --tasks is absent.
--workspace is honored and becomes the base for relative paths.
Prompt and tasks files are validated for existence with clear errors.

recommended.approach: Centralize path resolution so all callers use the same base directory.

tasks.title: Resolve workspace, tasks, and prompt paths in Rust

definition_of_done: --task-id selects a specific task or errors if missing.
--next selects the first task with status!=completed and model!=human.
Exit codes and stop reasons match ralph-loop behavior for human, blocked, or unmet dependencies.

recommended.approach: Introduce a stop-reason enum with explicit exit code mapping.

tasks.title: Implement task selection and stop reasons

definition_of_done: Selected task requires title, definition_of_done entries, and recommended.approach.
Missing metadata results in a clear error and non-zero exit.
Behavior matches bin/task-agent.sh validation.

recommended.approach: Validate task fields before any git or codex side effects.

tasks.title: Port task metadata validation

definition_of_done: lever reads and writes .ralph/rate_limit.json consistently with shell behavior.
Rate limit window and sleep behavior are preserved.
Errors are surfaced if rate limit state cannot be updated.

recommended.approach: Match the JSON shape and time calculations used by the bash script.

tasks.title: Port rate limit bookkeeping

definition_of_done: lever verifies git repo and captures original branch/HEAD.
Dirty working tree is stashed and restored per task-agent behavior.
Branch selection/creation for tasks mirrors the shell script.

recommended.approach: Implement git operations with Command calls and explicit error messages.

tasks.title: Port git safety and workspace setup

definition_of_done: lever constructs the prompt and invokes codex with the same inputs as the shell script.
Task status/observability fields are updated per current behavior.
Exit codes propagate and map to the correct stop reasons.

recommended.approach: Translate the bash sequence into structured Rust steps with explicit error handling.

tasks.title: Port codex invocation and task status updates

definition_of_done: --loop runs continuously when no count is provided (or 0) and stops on Ctrl-C.
--loop N runs exactly N iterations and honors --delay between cycles.
Loop exits with correct stop reason and exit code.

recommended.approach: Use an atomic flag for Ctrl-C and check between iterations.

tasks.title: Implement loop driver in Rust

definition_of_done: lever no longer calls bin/task-agent.sh or bin/ralph-loop.sh.
bin/task-agent.sh and bin/ralph-loop.sh are removed or clearly deprecated.
Any references to those scripts are cleaned from code and tests.

recommended.approach: Delete scripts once Rust parity is verified to avoid regressions.

tasks.title: Remove shell script dependency

definition_of_done: README.md documents lever as the only entry point and removes script install steps.
Loop semantics and exit codes are documented.
Docs reference the new flags and defaults.

recommended.approach: Keep docs concise and align wording with existing README style.

tasks.title: Update documentation for shell removal

definition_of_done: tests/ scripts call lever directly instead of shell wrappers.
Tests cover task discovery, loop counts, and stop reasons.
./tests/run.sh passes.

recommended.approach: Replace task-agent/ralph-loop references and add missing loop cases.

tasks.title: Update tests to target lever only

definition_of_done: Unit tests cover task selection with --task-id, --next, and default.
Unit tests cover stop-reason to exit-code mapping.
cargo test passes.

recommended.approach: Keep tests focused on pure helpers to avoid spawning external commands.

tasks.title: Add Rust unit tests for selection and exit codes
